title: Visual-Motor Integration Instructional Design for Anatomy Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy knowledge and foundational expertise in medical specialties
context.additional_context: Digital devices (tablets or laptops) are provided, with parallel use of physical skeletal models and 2D anatomy software.

learning_goals: Learners can identify 3D human skeletal structures with 90% accuracy within two weeks.
Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in bidirectional image (mirrored left-right) tests by the third week.
Learners demonstrate at least 20% improvement in spatial cognition skills through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
